Body: Why is the Arabic word جید (jayyid) which is pronounced gayyid in Egypt and means good, so similar to the word good or the German word gut? Is it a borrowing? (since the word for good is very different in Hebrew - it is טוב (tov)) If it is a borrowing, why would such a basic word have been borrowed by a people?
Title: Is the similarity between the Arabic word Gayyid and the English word Good due to a borrowing?

Travelling armchair linguist.
